nodes.name: SampleCrowdsaleToken

nodes.documentation:
@title SampleCrowdsale
@dev This is an example of a fully fledged crowdsale.
The way to add new features to a base crowdsale is by multiple inheritance.
In this example we are providing following extensions:
CappedCrowdsale - sets a max boundary for raised funds
RefundableCrowdsale - set a min goal to be reached and returns funds if it's not met
MintedCrowdsale - assumes the token can be minted by the crowdsale, which does so
when receiving purchases.
 * After adding multiple features it's good practice to run integration tests
to ensure that subcontracts works together as intended.
nodes.name: SampleCrowdsale

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SampleCrowdSale: goal is greater than cap"

@title SampleCrowdsale
@dev This is an example of a fully fledged crowdsale.
The way to add new features to a base crowdsale is by multiple inheritance.
In this example we are providing following extensions:
CappedCrowdsale - sets a max boundary for raised funds
RefundableCrowdsale - set a min goal to be reached and returns funds if it's not met
MintedCrowdsale - assumes the token can be minted by the crowdsale, which does so
when receiving purchases.
 * After adding multiple features it's good practice to run integration tests
to ensure that subcontracts works together as intended.

devdoc.details: This is an example of a fully fledged crowdsale. The way to add new features to a base crowdsale is by multiple inheritance. In this example we are providing following extensions: CappedCrowdsale - sets a max boundary for raised funds RefundableCrowdsale - set a min goal to be reached and returns funds if it's not met MintedCrowdsale - assumes the token can be minted by the crowdsale, which does so when receiving purchases. * After adding multiple features it's good practice to run integration tests to ensure that subcontracts works together as intended.

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

capReached().details: Checks whether the cap has been reached.

claimRefund(address).details: Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful.

finalize().details: Must be called after crowdsale ends, to do some extra finalization work. Calls the contract's finalization function.

finalized().return: true if the crowdsale is finalized, false otherwise.

goal().return: minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.

goalReached().details: Checks whether funding goal was reached.

hasClosed().details: Checks whether the period in which the crowdsale is open has already elapsed.

isOpen().return: true if the crowdsale is open, false otherwise.

rate().return: the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.

wallet().return: the address where funds are collected.

devdoc.title: SampleCrowdsale
